intro: Liebigia leuserensis, commonly known as the Leuser Valley liebigia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Sumatra. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense forest canopies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat destruction, it is considered an endangered species.
